name: cement production, type general use | cement, type general use | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/30608/documentation

This dataset describes the production of 1 kg cement type general use by means of dry process in Ecuador. The data is mainly retrieved from the publication of Petroche & Ramirez (2022), based on primary data from factories in Ecuador, and complemented with the information from local experts.;Reference: ;Petroche, D. M., & Ramirez, A. D. (2022). The environmental profile of clinker, cement, and concrete: a life cycle perspective study based on ecuadorian data. Buildings, 12(3), 311.

The activity starts with the reception of raw materials at the cement factory.

This activity ends with the production of 1 kg cement at the factory gate. The dataset includes the transport of materials within the factory area and related infrastructure. The dataset does not include packaging in cement bags, neither the production of waste.
category: C:Manufacturing/23:Manufacture of other non-metallic mineral products/239:Manufacture of non-metallic mineral products n.e.c./2395:Manufacture of articles of concrete, cement and plaster

processDocumentation.timeDescription: The time period is from 2019 (year of the data collection) to 2023 (data of the compilation of the dataset).
processDocumentation.geographyDescription: This dataset is representative of the production of cement in Ecuador; data come from factories in the country.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: Current production technology. The dataset covers the main technology for dry cement production in Ecuador. The cement is produced by adding a quantity of calcium sulfate, usually in form of gypsum (3%), and limestone (39%) to the clinker (58%). Then, in a cement mill, the mixture is ground to form the finished industrial powder.
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: The amount of limestone is calculated as difference between cement (reference product) and the sum of clinker and gypsum (inputs). Clinker and gypsum are the main inputs in terms of mass.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription:
Data come the publication of Petroche & Ramirez (2022), based on data from Ecuadorian factories, and complemented with information from local experts. The datasets for clinker and cement represent 62.8% of the production in Ecuador, according to Petroche (2021).

Reference: 
Petroche, D. M., & Ramirez, A. D. (2022). The environmental profile of clinker, cement, and concrete: a life cycle perspective study based on ecuadorian data. Buildings, 12(3), 311.
Petroche, D. (2021). Desempeño Ambiental del Cemento y del Concreto en el Ecuador: Una puerta a la Construcción Sostenible [Master’s degree thesis in  Industrial Eco-efficiency, Escuela Superior Politécnica del Litoral]. https://www.dspace.espol.edu.ec/bitstream/123456789/52614/1/T-88998%20%20DANIEL%20PETROCHE%20S%C3%81NCHEZ.pdf

exchanges.description: Calculated value, based on the publication Petroche & Ramirez (2022) and information from local experts. The gross grid electricity of an overall Ecuadorian plant is 261348000 kWh per 2296876 tonne of cement produced in the year 2021, from which the electricity needed to produce clinker (0.07124 kWh/kg cement) is subtracted.
